However, this was offset by an acceleration in energy prices, which prevented inflation from falling more sharply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Relief for more than four million Ukrainian refugees currently living in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Council on Thursday agreed to extend the temporary protection status for refugees fleeing the war in Ukraine. This grants them the certainty that they will be allowed to stay in the bloc until March 2025 without the need to examine individual applications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commissioner for Home Affairs says approximately 250,000 people per week cross the borders between Ukraine and the EU in both directions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's been the fastest growing refugee crisis faced by Europe since World War II, and the EU has repeated that it will continue to support the people of Ukraine as long as it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The year-long extension will give Ukrainians living in the European Union more certainty as the war in their country drags on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Triggered days after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, the temporary protection status gives them the right to residency and housing in European Union countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It also means they are allowed to work, their children can attend school and they can access medical and social welfare assistance. Temporary protection is an EU emergency mechanism which is activated in exceptional circumstances of mass influx and was first adopted in 2001.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: EU countries say they are very close to striking a deal on how to manage sudden massive arrivals of migrants in Europe. The so-called crisis regulation, as it's being called, allows member states to quickly admit people in need of international protection, but also extends the deadlines to fast-track asylum applications. Not all countries are on board, though.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: During the negotiations, Italy and Germany clashed about a reference to NGO vessels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But the Spanish E.U. presidency is still confident of reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is a matter of nuance, which often takes a little longer to close and to reach that agreement. más de cerrarse y de conseguir ese acuerdo. Pero es una cuestión de los 27 y los 27 estoy convencido que en breve, en los próximos días, podremos llegar a ese acuerdo total.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Este es el último pie que se ha perdido para ser acordado entre los estados miembros cuando se trata del pacto de migración de la EU, que es la reforma de la política migratoria propuesta por la Com the European Commission in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: EU countries already agreed measures to change the asylum system aimed at alleviating pressure on frontline member states like Italy and Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Once everything is eventually agreed, the Council will have to negotiate the entire migration pact with the European Parliament, where positions vary massively, one point being that some member states don't consider mandatory relocations among the EU countries a solution to a crisis situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the Parliament is insisting on this point. Yes, I know that there's reluctance, there's resistance. But yes, the pro-European majority in the European Parliament has made it clear in our mandate for negotiation that we want, in situations of crisis, mandatory relocation programmes, which is the European scale of response in a situation as the one which is enduring now, Lampedusa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The EU aims to reach an agreement on the migration pact before the end of the year. Individual member states won't have a right to veto it if they disagree, since the decision will be taken by a qualified majority of EU countries.

This time round counterterrorism is top of the agenda.
